dataIdInfo.idPurp: This shapefile is a global coastline buffer, set to 1500 m beyond the coastline shapefile served by GSHHG.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The Global Self-Consistent, Hierarchical, High-Resolution Geography (GSHHG) Database serves a shapefile of the coastlines of the world drawn from databases in the public domain. This shapefile combines the data from Full Resolution L1 and L6 datasets from GSHHG (Version 2.3.7 released June 15, 2017). L1 is the boundary between land and ocean for all lands except Antarctica. L6 is the boundary between the Antarctica grounding-line and the ocean. The merged dataset was then buffered to 1500 m for use as a water mask for InSAR products.

More information about the GSHHG is available at http://www.soest.hawaii.edu/wessel/gshhg/.
dataIdInfo.idCredit:
GSHHG is developed and maintained by Paul Wessel, SOEST, University of Hawai'i, Honolulu, HI. Walter H. F. Smith, NOAA Geosciences Lab, National Ocean Service, Silver Spring, MD.
Buffer processing by Heidi Kristenson, Alaska Satellite Facility.
